results.title: Lisinopril-Induced Acute Necrotizing Pancreatitis
results.text_hl: A 53-year-old Caucasian male with a history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ presented with a one-day history of @<m>DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea, vomiting@@@, and severe @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@epigastric pain@@@.

citations.NLM: Syed SB, Reyes JVM, Baig M. Lisinopril-Induced Acute Necrotizing Pancreatitis Cureus. 2021 Apr 23;13(4):e14642. PMID: 34046276

results.title: Extra-adrenal pheochromocytoma presenting as inverse takotsubo-pattern cardiomyopathy treated with surgical resection.
results.text_hl: She was started on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10 mg daily.

citations.NLM: Tafreshi S, Naqvi SY, Thomas S. Extra-adrenal pheochromocytoma presenting as inverse takotsubo-pattern cardiomyopathy treated with surgical resection. BMJ Case Rep. 2018 Dec 9;11(1):. PMID: 30567218
